channel.title: Journal.ie – Daily 9-at-9 Mirror
channel.description: Locally mirrored feed of TheJournal.ie Daily 9-at-9 bulletins.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: Country set for freezing conditions, Seamus Culleton could be deported early as next week, and children spending years in emergency Tusla arrangements.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Reality of home bidding in Ireland, Hutch to run in by-election, and Larry Murrin survives vote.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: Maxwell to appear before US Congress, Starmer under fire, and women speak about dropped sexual violence cases.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: Status Orange rain warning for four counties, US and Iran prepare for talks, and Keir Starmer under pressure over Peter Mandelson scandal

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Weather warnings, Jeffrey Epstein’s potential AIB deal and growth in data usage in Ireland…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Wednesday
item.description: Public opinion on fox hunting, new rules for e-bikes and e-scooters users and Peter Mandelson to quit the House of Lords…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Clintons to testify in Epstein investigation, Russia resumes strikes on Ukraine and Claire Byrne takes up new role…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: Epstein files, a visit with the Pope and asylum seeker protests…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: Rafah crossing partially reopens, Dublin Racing Festival to go ahead and Iran says progress made towards US talks…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: Today’s Dublin Racing Festival postponed, weekend weather and a US government shutdown…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: The impacts of nitrous oxide, more rain warnings and a halt on Russian attacks on Kyiv…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Transport delays in Dublin, further rain warnings in ‘saturated’ areas and rules on scramblers…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Wednesday
item.description: Planning enforcement actions, an attack on a US congresswoman and three killed in Ukraine.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: School absences, organised crime suspect arrested and massive US winter storm claims lives…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: Cross-border crackdown on ‘escort’ sites, Irish general in the top EU military job and the man shot by federal agents in Minneapolis is named.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: Coalition TDs on whether the Taoiseach should go to the White House, US braces for winter storm and The Traitors finale.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: Trump backs down on tariffs, the EU’s top general on European defence and Irish hopes high ahead of Oscar nominations.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Trump’s latest threats over Greenland, concerns over domestic violence register and Cabinet to sign off on State-led childcare facilities.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: At least 39 dead after Spain train collision, Tánaiste to discuss fresh US tariff threats, and inquest into death of Belfast schoolboy to get under way

item.title: The 9 at 9: Sunday
item.description: The political response to the Grok scandal, Trump’s tariff threat over Greenland and man dies in early morning Galway crash.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Saturday
item.description: Our readers share their views on Hot School Meals, EU plans to audit Mercosur beef and Tony Blair’s new job.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Row over judge’s remarks on cyclists, Trump pressures Iran and much to discuss as Dáil returns.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: Here’s all the news to know as you start your day.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Thursday
item.description: US to run Venezuela “indefinitely”, Tusla staff warn reforms could put children at risk, and a snowy storm on the way

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: Defence spending warning, Maduro’s replacement sworn in and McEntee talks Ukraine in Paris…

item.title: The 9 at 9: Monday
item.description: Here’s all the news to know as you start your day.

item.title: The 9 at 9: Friday
item.description: Investigators race to identify victims of Swiss bar fire, average price of a house rises again and Dublin City Council personal injury payouts.

item.title: The 9 at 9: New Year's Day
item.description: Budget changes kick in, New Year revellers killed in Swiss bar fire and a new member of the Euro club.

item.title: The 9 at 9: New Year's Eve
item.description: Dog attacks on postal workers, road policing and Eurostar services resume

item.title: The 9 at 9: Tuesday
item.description: The EU Presidency, the impact of U2′s The Joshua Tree, and updates on Bondi Beach mass shooting suspects.
